glsa.title: Gaim: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Gaim is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code or to a Denial of Service.

background.p: Gaim is a full featured instant messaging client which handles a variety of instant messaging protocols.

description.p: Brandon Perry discovered that Gaim is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow when handling away messages (CAN-2005-2103). Furthermore, Daniel Atallah discovered a vulnerability in the handling of file transfers (CAN-2005-2102).

impact.p: A remote attacker could create a specially crafted away message which, when viewed by the target user, could lead to the execution of arbitrary code. Also, an attacker could send a file with a non-UTF8 filename to a user, which would result in a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
